sentences.english: The price ceilings were rejigged according to quality.
sentences.chinese: 物價的最高限價按照質量的好壞進行了調整。

sentences.english: The nature of limited price for single disease was health accessibility.
sentences.chinese: 認爲單病種限價問題本質上是衛生服務可及性問題。

sentences.english: A stop order is also an order placed to buy or sell at a certain price.
sentences.chinese: 止蝕限價也是指在某一價格買入或賣出的限價。

sentences.english: A stop order is also an order placed to buy or sell at a certain price.
sentences.chinese: 止蝕限價也是指在某一價格買入或賣出的限價。

sentences.english: Sparkling wines are getting better in quality and are now an acceptable, cheaper alternative to champagne.
sentences.chinese: 汽酒限價比比較高，是香檳的廉價替代品。

sentences.english: Not only build the Low-incoming House, like Public-Rent-House or Price-Limit-House.
sentences.chinese: 不止是建設些保障住房，比如公租房或者限價房。

sentences.english: Rarely transacting "at the market" and preferring to put price limits on their buy and sell orders.
sentences.chinese: 很少按市價交易，而更喜歡爲買賣委託單設置限價。

sentences.english: A limit order lets you control the price, with no assurance of a fill.
sentences.chinese: 限價單能讓你控制價格，但不能保證成交。

sentences.english: Although capping prices has an honorable motive, the low pay inevitably leads to corruption.
sentences.chinese: 雖然限價的初衷是好的，但這不可避免地導致了腐敗。

definition: song cycle in Chinese opera/(fig.) a series of tricks/polite remarks/number of (things that are counted in 套[tao4], like houses)
(Tw) to lower (prices, interest rates etc)/to reduce/to cut
HDB flats/public apartment flats (in Singapore and Malaysia)
to consult and act upon/privately run/commercial
price competition/bid (in an auction)/to compete on price/to bid against sb
to reduce or waive (taxes, punishment, rent, tuition etc)
